reasoning.correctness: Gold Answer lists respiratory symptoms: increased cough frequency, increased green-yellow sputum, hemoptysis, worsened dyspnea, reduced exercise tolerance. Systemic: possible fever, sinus pressure, mild headache. Most bothersome: cough [P-12]. Generated correctly lists main respiratory symptoms (cough, sputum, hemoptysis, SOB) from [P-1], and fever. However, misses reduced exercise tolerance [P-4], sinus pressure [P-12], headache [P-14]; incorrectly states shortness of breath as most bothersome (citing [P-1], but patient explicitly says cough is most bothersome [P-12]). Significant contradiction on key element (most bothersome symptom).
reasoning.completeness: Gold key points: 5 respiratory (cough, sputum, hemoptysis, dyspnea, exercise tol), 3 systemic (fever, sinus, headache), 1 most bothersome (cough). Generated covers 4 respiratory, 1 systemic, 0 for most bothersome (wrong one). ~50-60% coverage (core respiratory good, but misses several and errs on critical point).
reasoning.faithfulness: All respiratory and fever claims verifiable in cited [P-1] and [P-9]. Most bothersome claim (SOB as primary/most bothersome) not verifiable in transcript and contradicts [P-12] (cough stated as most bothersome); it's a misinterpretation/hallucination of priority despite [P-1] describing SOB. No other fabrications, mostly grounded but with key error.
reasoning.relevance: Directly structures response around respiratory symptoms, systemic symptoms, and most bothersome symptom, perfectly matching question structure with no off-topic content.

summary: The Generated Answer accurately captures core respiratory symptoms and one systemic symptom but misses others, has a significant factual error on the most bothersome symptom, and is otherwise well-grounded and relevant.
